application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Demolition of the existing garages, and erection of a two storey building comprising two flats including associated access, cycle storage, landscaping, refuse and recycling storage
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted ([Cover Letter], [Planning Statement], [Preliminary Arboricultural Assessment], [Arboricultural Impact Assessment], [Energy and Sustainability Statement], [Preliminary Ecological Appraisal], [Civil Engineering SuDS Assessment Report],  [Preliminary Bat Roost Assessment], [Statement of Community Involvement], [Daylight and Sunlight Report], [Duck Emergence Bat Survey], [London Development Database Management],  [Transport Statement], [200582-1003],  [200582-1080], Received: 22/12/2021, [200582-1081], Received: 15/03/2021, [Design and Access Statement], [200582-1082],  [200582-1083], [200582-1080], [200582-1307-2], Received: 16/04/2021) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted must be in accordance with the approved plans.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of secure cycle storage arrangements in accordance with both the London Plan and adopted Local Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The cycle parking shall conform to the West London Cycle Parking Guidance. The cycle stores shall be made available to occupants upon first occupation of the hereby approved development and maintained as such thereafter without obstruction.

Condition : 5 - Prior to commencement of development, a Construction Logistics Plan shall be submitted to an approved by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall take place in accordance with the details approved.
Condition : 6 - The hereby approved development must be carried out in accordance with the approved Energy Statement received 22/12/2020, and achieve net 'Zero Carbon' emissions.

Condition : 7 - Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 9 - The developments shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:
o	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
o	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
o	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 10 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the existing vehicular access to Fir Road shall be permanently closed and the kerbs, verge, and footway reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.

Condition : 11 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant shall have submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing a final detailed drainage design, including drawings and supporting calculations [and an updated Drainage Assessment Form to be reviewed and approved by the Lead Local Flood Authority]. The drainage hierarchy should make use of green infrastructure technology to comply with the hierarchy set out in London Plan Policy SI3 and the runoff rate should not exceed 2 litres/second.  A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components shall also be submitted and approved which demonstrates how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the approved details.

Condition : 12 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.

Condition : 13 - The details of hard and soft landscaping including the tree protection as shown on the approved plans and specifications shall be laid out and planted before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use and retained as such thereafter. Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation.
